articles.description: Rudy Giuliani got upset with a Michigan lawmaker when asked about a report that Giuliani sought a preemptive pardon from President Donald Trump.

articles.author: Harmeet Kaur and Naomi Thomas, CNN
articles.title: Black, Hispanic and Native American workers and their families face greater coronavirus exposure risks, report finds
articles.description: Those workers are more likely to work in jobs that require them to leave their homes, putting them at greater risk of the virus -- another example of the racial disparities highlighted by the Covid-19 crisis.

articles.author: Isaac Engelberg and Harmeet Kaur, CNN
articles.title: Sheriff who refused to enforce restrictions tests positive for Covid-19
articles.description: As California Gov. Gavin Newsom ordered restrictions aimed at curbing a surge of Covid-19 cases in the state, Sacramento County Sheriff Scott Jones declined to enforce them. Now, Jones has tested positive for the virus.

articles.title: Google unlawfully fired worker organizers, federal agency alleges
articles.description: Google violated labor laws when it fired two vocal employees in 2019, according to a complaint filed by the National Labor Relations Board on Wednesday.

articles.title: The economy is screaming out for help. Washington needs to listen
articles.description: The economic recovery is rapidly losing momentum, and millions of Americans are counting on Uncle Sam to come to the rescue. Yet politicians have so far failed to reach a deal on what should be a no-brainer: more fiscal relief.

articles.title: Kenosha shooting suspect Kyle Rittenhouse ordered to stand trial
articles.description: Kyle Rittenhouse was ordered Thursday to stand trial in the fatal shooting of two men and the wounding of another in August during protests in Kenosha, Wisconsin.

articles.title: Bash: Almost everything you heard from the President is a lie
articles.description: President Trump repeated baseless claims of "massive fraud" and a "rigged election" at the White House after both state officials and Attorney General Bill Barr have said there is no evidence of widespread election fraud.
